title: How to Make Yogurt Berry Muffins

steps.headline: Mix the yogurt, oil, eggs, honey, and vanilla.
Sift the flour in another bowl, along with the baking soda and bicarbonate of soda.
Fold the flour mixture into the wet mixture carefully until thoroughly mixed.
Pour into a greased or lined muffin tray.
Crush (blend, mash or process) the berries or strawberries.
Preheat the oven to 190ºC/375ºF.
steps.description: Set out the muffin pan; grease if required.

steps.headline: Add the flour, sugar, cinnamon, salt and baking powder to a mixing bowl.
Break the eggs into another bowl.
Add the yogurt, vegetable oil and mashed berries to the whisked eggs.
Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Mix together until moist. Do not over mix.

steps.headline: Place the muffin pan into the pre-heated oven.
steps.description: Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Test for readiness by inserting a toothpick; if it comes out clean, the muffins are ready.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Let cool for up to 5 minutes in the pan. Then place the muffins on a wire cooling rack to cool.

steps.headline: Serve.
Preheat the oven to 200ºC/400ºF.
steps.description: Grease the muffin pan if needed. Alternatively, use cupcake cases.

steps.headline: Place the flour, quick-cooking oats, brown sugar, ground cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, ground nutmeg and salt into a mixing bowl.
In a separate bowl, mix together the egg, yogurt and melted butter.
Pour the egg mixture into the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Stir until just moistened. Do not over mix.

steps.headline: Fold in the blueberries.
Transfer the batter to the muffin pan.
steps.description: Fill about three quarters of the way with batter.

steps.headline: Place in the preheated oven.
steps.description: Bake for 18-22 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into a muffin comes out clean.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Let cool briefly for 5 minutes in the pan, then move to a wire cooling rack to cool down more.

steps.headline: Serve warm with butter.

text: Yogurt, berries and oat muffins Mix the yogurt, oil, eggs, honey, and vanilla. Carefully stir in the berries. Sift the flour in another bowl, along with the baking soda and bicarbonate of soda. Mix in the oats. Fold the flour mixture into the wet mixture carefully until thoroughly mixed.  Pour into a greased or lined muffin tray. Bake at 180ºC/350ºF for about 30 minutes. Cinnamon yogurt berry muffins Crush (blend, mash or process) the berries or strawberries. Keep the juice. Preheat the oven to 190ºC/375ºF. Set out the muffin pan; grease if required. Add the flour, sugar, cinnamon, salt and baking powder to a mixing bowl. Mix well to combine. Break the eggs into another bowl. Whisk the eggs. Add the yogurt, vegetable oil and mashed berries to the whisked eggs. Stir together. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients. Mix together until moist. Do not over mix. Place the muffin pan into the pre-heated oven. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Test for readiness by inserting a toothpick; if it comes out clean, the muffins are ready. Remove from the oven. Let cool for up to 5 minutes in the pan. Then place the muffins on a wire cooling rack to cool. Serve.  Blueberry oatmeal yogurt muffins Preheat the oven to 200ºC/400ºF. Grease the muffin pan if needed. Alternatively, use cupcake cases. Place the flour, quick-cooking oats, brown sugar, ground cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, ground nutmeg and salt into a mixing bowl. Stir to combine. In a separate bowl, mix together the egg, yogurt and melted butter. Stir until combined. Pour the egg mixture into the dry ingredients. Stir until just moistened. Do not over mix. Fold in the blueberries.  Transfer the batter to the muffin pan. Fill about three quarters of the way with batter. Place in the preheated oven. Bake for 18-22 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into a muffin comes out clean. Remove from the oven. Let cool briefly for 5 minutes in the pan, then move to a wire cooling rack to cool down more. Serve warm with butter.
